Prepifg Module¶

This Python module converts interferogram input files to a common geotiff format with PyRate specific metadata headers. The module also implements multilooking/downsampling and cropping operations to reduce the size of the computational problem.

pyrate.prepifg.CustomExts¶

alias of CustExtents

exception pyrate.prepifg.PreprocessError[source]¶

Preprocess exception

pyrate.prepifg.dem_or_ifg(data_path)[source]¶

Returns an Ifg or DEM class object from input geotiff file.

Parameters:data_path (str) – file path name
Returns:Interferogram or DEM object from input file
Return type:Ifg or DEM class object
pyrate.prepifg.get_analysis_extent(crop_opt, rasters, xlooks, ylooks, user_exts)[source]¶

Function checks prepifg parameters and returns extents/bounding box.

Parameters:
  • crop_opt (int) – Cropping option
  • rasters (list) – List of either Ifg or DEM class objects
  • xlooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in x
  • ylooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in y
  • user_exts (tuple) – Tuple of user defined cropping coordinates
Returns:

extents: tuple of four bounding coordinates
Return type:

tuple
pyrate.prepifg.prepare_ifg(raster_path, xlooks, ylooks, exts, thresh, crop_opt, write_to_disk=True)[source]¶

Open, resample, crop and optionally save to disk an interferogram or DEM. Returns are only given if write_to_disk=False

Parameters:
  • raster_path (str) – Raster file path name
  • xlooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in x; 5 is 5 times smaller, 1 is no change
  • ylooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in y
  • exts (tuple) – Tuple of user defined georeferenced extents for new file: (xfirst, yfirst, xlast, ylast)cropping coordinates
  • thresh (float) – see thresh in prepare_ifgs()
  • crop_opt (int) – Crop option
  • write_to_disk (bool) – Write new data to disk
Returns:

resampled_data: output cropped and resampled image
Return type:

ndarray
Returns:

out_ds: destination gdal dataset object
Return type:

gdal.Dataset
pyrate.prepifg.prepare_ifgs(raster_data_paths, crop_opt, xlooks, ylooks, thresh=0.5, user_exts=None, write_to_disc=True)[source]¶

Wrapper function to prepare a sequence of interferogram files for PyRate analysis. See prepifg.prepare_ifg() for full description of inputs and returns.

Note: function need refining for crop options

Parameters:
  • raster_data_paths (list) – List of interferogram file paths
  • crop_opt (int) – Crop option
  • xlooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in x; 5 is 5 times smaller, 1 is no change
  • ylooks (int) – Number of multi-looks in y
  • thresh (float) – see thresh in prepare_ifgs()
  • user_exts (tuple) – Tuple of user defined georeferenced extents for new file: (xfirst, yfirst, xlast, ylast)cropping coordinates
  • write_to_disk (bool) – Write new data to disk
Returns:

resampled_data: output cropped and resampled image
Return type:

ndarray
Returns:

out_ds: destination gdal dataset object
Return type:

gdal.Dataset
